content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Here is an example of how you might write a `show` method for a `FloatWithUnits` struct in Julia:

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits{T<:Real}
    value::T
    unit::String
end

function Base.show(io::IO, fwu::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, fwu.value, " ", fwu.unit)
end
```
This `Base.show` function gets called when you try to print a FloatWithUnits value, and it will call the function to print out the value and unit as requested. Note that the method is generic over the type of real number used in the struct (T), allowing it to work with any kind of number you want.
